Articles.Content:
Hi I am a aspiriing fighter pilot who has landed on the mun and minmus several times but has issues docking i think i figured it out now i am going to launch tug and the first part of my space station this weekend.

its nice ot meet your also i have caught myself hitting > to time warp lectures. and i wish i had gotten ksp a year ago when we were doing orbital mechanics in physics

Welcome to the community wrhicks14

Good luck with the docking, it's hardest the first time, but after that it's fine, just remember to take your time at it as if you rush you'll have trouble.

Welcome to the forums!

You say you're an aspiring fighter pilot. Do you mind if I ask which service you intend to join?

As sal_vager has already stated, a big part of learning to dock is just having the patience to get the maneuvers right. Don't be surprised if your first successful one takes a while to get down; it gets quicker and easier with practice as you get a feel for how the mechanics interact. If you're stuck on a particular part of it, feel free to ask questions or check out one of the rendezvous and docking tutorials I've listed on the Drawing Board, which is conveniently linked in my signature.

Hope this helps
